For several important medicinal species there is very limited evidence for either safety or efficacy or altogether, including but not limited to Tagetes erecta, Piper auritum, Byrsonima crassifolia, Bursera simaruba, Artemisia ludoviciana, Hyptis verticillata, Spondias purpurea Tradescantia zebrina Crescentia cujete, Parmentiera aculeata, Piper amalago, Baccharis inamoena, Bougainvillea glabra, Lepidium virginicum, Malvaviscus arboreus, Mimosa albida, Solanum lycopersicum, Cornutia pyramidata, Dorstenia contrajerva, Tagetes filifolia and Jatropha curcas (
Table 3 ). This situation emphasizes the lacking knowledge base and the concerns regarding toxicity of native botanical drug species widely used in traditional medicine throughout MA ( Caceres Guido et al., 2015; Valdivia-Correa et al., 2016; Alonso-Castro et al., 2017b).
